meanings.definition: Supervising an examination or testing situation.
meanings.sent1: During the test, the teacher was proctoring to ensure no one cheated.
meanings.sent2: The professor will be proctoring the final exam next week.
meanings.sent3: The robot proctoring the exam malfunctioned and started dancing instead.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes proctoring the room like a hawk, catching any signs of dishonesty.
meanings.sent5: The image of the teacher proctoring the exam is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: The act of overseeing or monitoring a test.
meanings.sent1: His proctoring of the exam was thorough and fair.
meanings.sent2: The proctoring for the standardized test was done by trained professionals.
meanings.sent3: The proctoring of the spelling bee turned into a comedy show with unexpected words.
meanings.sent4: The proctoring of the test felt like a silent guardian watching over the students.
meanings.sent5: The importance of proper proctoring cannot be underestimated in maintaining test integrity.

meanings.definition: To watch over or invigilate a test.
meanings.sent1: The teacher proctoring the exam made sure no one used any unauthorized materials.
meanings.sent2: She will be proctoring the math test to prevent any cheating.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to proctor the test by sitting on the answer sheet.
meanings.sent4: His gaze proctoring the room was intimidating, making students nervous.
meanings.sent5: The security cameras proctoring the exam room recorded every movement.
